intro: Lotononis mollis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming compact rosettes of leaves. Its flowers, which come in a range of colors including pink, purple, and white, bloom in spring and summer. Lotononis mollis is widely cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
